title: Crash in 0.15.RC1

labels.name: E:Desktop Bugfixes 0.15
labels.description: Misc bug fixes in Desktop app overall for 0.15

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

Just updated to 0.15.rc1 and it crashed right after login

logs:
```
ERR 2023-11-10 10:27:45.270-05:00 rpc response error                         topics="rpc" tid=474306 file=core.nim:36 err="\nstatus-go error [methodName:ens_getName, code:-32000, message:not a resolver ]\n"

Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

```
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```


## Steps to reproduce

1. Update to 0.15.rc1 on arelease account
2. Login
3. wait a second
4. crash

#### Expected behavior

no crash

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: 0.15.rc1
- Operating System: Ubuntu 20
I think maybe it's related to https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/12605

I think I made a discovery. I commented out everything in the app after the login, so basically, it logs in, but we don't load anything.
Like that, it doesn't crash, it just spins forever and I can see that we receive some background signals from status-go.

However, if I uncomment `self.generalService.startMessenger()`, then it crashes. We do not fire any events from this or receive any signal, it's just status-go starting the Messenger.

I found that geth.log always shows the same last line(s) when it crashes:
```
INFO [11-10|15:33:36.006|github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/messenger.go:3688]                      processing message                       type=CONTACT_CODE_ADVERTISEMENT senderID=0x04cc5cb41642258361a3bfa4a527a6f5b421469a4f5d06ef3233662f97a4365c5211472351e95ca9e339dbe3895f03488b08f0ac7164dd6e3690f6d55520cba986
INFO [11-10|15:33:36.007|github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/messenger_handlers.go:475]              handling ContactCodeAdvertisement 
DEBUG[11-10|15:33:36.007|github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/messenger_handler.go:2840]              settings found                           viewFromContacts=false viewFromNoOne=false
```

I'm diging deeper into it
I found that it crashes somewhere in `BuildProfileShowcaseFromIdentity`. If I comment it out, it works fine. cc @MishkaRogachev
Ok, I found the issue in `BuildProfileShowcaseFromIdentity`, but it still crashes afterwards. It seems in a different place.

> Ok, I found the issue in `BuildProfileShowcaseFromIdentity`, but it still crashes afterwards. It seems in a different place.

I installed the package from [this pr](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/12700) which contains, just this fix for `BuildProfileShowcaseFromIdentity` and I no longer have the crash.
